com.mr.moviecatalogue.controller

Class MovieCatalogueController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mr.moviecatalogue.controller.MovieCatalogueController

  • @RestController
public class MovieCatalogueController
extends java.lang.Object
    RestController class to define URIs, provide validation on requests and then call Service class to perform the logic of the application

    • Method Detail

      • getMovies

        @GetMapping(value="/movies")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Catalogue> getMovies(@RequestParam(required=false,value="director")
                                                                                                  java.lang.String director,
                                                                                                  @RequestParam(required=false,value="title")
                                                                                                  java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                  @RequestParam(required=false,value="rating")
                                                                                                  java.lang.String ratingString)
        Calls the service method to return the current movie catalogue. Accepts request parameters to search based on title, director name and rating. If title is passed, other request parameters are ignored as this is the primary key and must be unique, duplicate titles are not allowed. Director and rating parameters can be used simultaneously.
        Parameters:
        title - Optional title to search for. Case sensitive.
        director - Optional director to search for. * or % can be used as wildcards - e.g. Ben* or Ben% returns results for all directors starting with Ben.
        ratingString - Optional rating to search for movies above the given rating. Must be within range 0.0 - 5.0 and will be rounded down to 1 decimal place.
        Returns:
        Returns the movie catalogue

      • addMovie

        @PostMapping(value="/movies")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> addMovie(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                            MovieIO movieIO)
        Calls the service method to add a movie to the catalogue. Returns 400 bad request if request body is null or contains no title
        Parameters:
        movieIO - MovieIO containing mandatory title string, and optional director name and rating value. Rating must be between 0.0 and 5.0 if present.
        Returns:
        Http status code

      • editMovie

        @PatchMapping(value="/movies/{title}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> editMovie(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                      MovieIO movieIO,
                                                                                                                                      @PathVariable(value="title")
                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String title)
        Calls the service method to edit a pre-existing movie in the database, identified by the path variable which is the title of the movie to be edited. Returns 400 bad request if request body is null, or title is null or empty string
        Parameters:
        movieIO - MovieIO containing the fields to be changes. All values inside are optional.
        title - The current title of the movie to be edited - mandatory parameter passed as path variable.
        Returns:
        Http status code

      • clearCatalogue

        @DeleteMapping(value="/movies")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> clearCatalogue()
        Calls the database service to drop the database from the SQL server, clearing the stored data
        Returns:
        Http status code

      • deleteDirectorFromMovie

        @DeleteMapping(value="/movies/{title}/director")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> deleteDirectorFromMovie(@PathVariable(value="title")
                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String title)
        Deletes the director from the movie in the database for the given title
        Parameters:
        title - The current title of the movie to have director deleted - mandatory parameter passed as path variable.
        Returns:
        Http status code

      • deleteRatingFromMovie

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> deleteRatingFromMovie(@PathVariable(value="title")
                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String title)
        Deletes the rating from the movie in the database for the given title
        Parameters:
        title - The current title of the movie to have rating deleted - mandatory parameter passed as path variable.
        Returns:
        Http status code

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> deleteMovie(@PathVariable(value="title")
                                                                                                                                         java.lang.String title)
        Deletes the movie from the database for the given title
        Parameters:

      • deleteDirector

        @DeleteMapping(value="/movies/directors/{director}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> deleteDirector(@PathVariable(value="director")
                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.String director)
        Deletes the given director from all movies with the given director
        Parameters:
        director - The current title of the director to be edited - mandatory parameter passed as path variable.
        Returns:
        Http status code

      • addDirector

        @PostMapping(value="/movies/directors")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> addDirector(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                         DirectorIO directorIO)
        Validates the request body object and calls the service method to add the given director to all the movies in the given list of titles. Will return 400 bad request and won't update any movies if the list of titles contains any title that is not already stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        directorIO - Request body DirectorIO containing the name of the director to be added (mandatory) and the list of movies to be added to (must contain at least one movie)
        Returns:
        Http status code
